FYI, this should be fixed in 1.1. Philip Tucker | Software Engineer | ptucker@google.com |
…
On Mon, Mar 27, 2017 at 9:57 AM, Andrés Huertas Suarez < ***@***.***> wrote: Yeah i ended up solving it by doing something similar, "masking" the streaming_mean function, and passint to it weights = tf.ones( shape= () , dtype=tf.float32 ) that did the trink ;) thanks. — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. body_text:
FYI, this should be fixed in 1.1.


Philip Tucker |  Software Engineer |  ptucker@google.com |
…
On Mon, Mar 27, 2017 at 9:57 AM, Andrés Huertas Suarez < ***@***.***> wrote:
 Yeah

 i ended up solving it by doing something similar, "masking" the
 streaming_mean function, and passint to it weights = tf.ones( shape= () ,
 dtype=tf.float32 )

 that did the trink ;) thanks.

body:
FYI, this should be fixed in 1.1.


Philip Tucker |  Software Engineer |  ptucker@google.com |

On Mon, Mar 27, 2017 at 9:57 AM, Andrés Huertas Suarez <
notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Yeah
>
> i ended up solving it by doing something similar, "masking" the
> streaming_mean function, and passint to it weights = tf.ones( shape= () ,
> dtype=tf.float32 )
>
> that did the trink ;) thanks.
